radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended with multiple, shadowing stones. One stone at the neck of the gallbladder did not move with decubitus positioning. No pericholecystic fluid. The gallbladder wall measures 4-5 mm in thickness. The hepatic parenchyma is hyperechoic with area of sparing adjacent to the gallbladder fossa. No focal liver mass. No intrahepatic biliary dilation. CBD measures 3 mm. Normal echogenicity of the spleen, kidneys, and pancreas.
